verses.roman:
anyera saṅgame āmi yata sukha pāi
tāhā haite rādhā-sukha śata adhikāi

synonyms: anyera—others; saṅgame—by meeting; āmi—I; yata—all; sukha—happiness; pāi—get; tāhā haite—than that; rādhā-sukha—happiness by association with Rādhārāṇī; śata—one hundred times; adhikāi—increased.
translation: "The happiness I feel when meeting Rādhārāṇī is a hundred times greater than the happiness I get from meeting others."
